arm_group.description: Pulmonary vein isolation: Ablation along the ablation line is continued until loss of pace capture along the ablation line is achieved
Pulmonary vein isolation: Ablation is discontinued when electrical isolation of the pulmonary veins is achieved.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study was to assess the near-term (12 months) efficacy of pulmonary vein
      isolation using a standard approach compared to application of an additional acute
      procedural endpoint of unexcitability along the ablation line.

clinical_study.brief_title: Unexcitability Along the Ablation as an Endpoint for Atrial Fibrillation Ablation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  written informed consent

          -  age > 18 years

          -  paroxysmal atrial fibrillation

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  structural heart disease

          -  intracardiac thrombus

          -  reversible causes of atrial fibrillation

          -  inability to take warfarin

intervention.description: catheter based ablation using irrigated catheters and radiofrequency energy as in clinical practice

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices

primary_outcome.description: recurrence of AF as assessed by 3 day holter monitoring
assessment of AT recurrence using 3 day holter monitoring

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: time needed to complete the procedure
complication such as groin hematoma, stroke and pericardial bleed prolonging the hospital stay will be assessed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to three days after the procedure

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
